programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: Gary pretends to get a tattoo of Charlotte's initials behind his ear, but she freaks out and says something she regrets. Meanwhile there's drama between Aaron and Marnie. (S9, ep7)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: It's Christmas in the Geordie Shore house! But there are tears amidst the tinsel when Vicky returns with unexpected news. Kyle hopes for a special Xmas present from Holly. (S9, ep8)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: When Charlotte finds out about a pact between Gary and Aaron she hatches a plan - but will she end up with egg on her face? Meanwhile James is having doubts about his future in the house. (S10, ep1)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: James makes a shock announcement and two new housemates come through the door. But the newbies' first night out is ruined when a fight breaks out between Charlotte, Marnie and Holly. (S10, ep2)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: It's the Newbies' first morning in the house but with Holly, Kyle and Charlotte gone how will the family get back together? A shock revelation from Gary leaves Charlotte heartbroken. (S10, ep3)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: It's the day that Charlotte's been dreading, Gary introduces his new girlfriend to the family but will Psycho Charlotte put in an appearance? Meanwhile Marnie and Aaron get very flirty! (S10, ep4)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: When Anna says there's a job for the Geordies in another country, they're all buzzing! That is until they turn up to a Caravan site in Wales. Marnie decides to give Aaron some home truths. (S10, ep5)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: Hamburg is about to feel the full force of Tash on Tours, but are they ready for Marnie kicking off at Aaron? Holly's getting paranoid about her non-relationship with Kyle. (S10, ep6)

programme.title: 16 & Pregnant: Unseen Moments 2
programme.desc: Unseen moments from the episodes Brooke, Felicia, Emily, Markai, Aubrey, Christinna, Kayla, Megan, and Ashley.

programme.title: 16 & Pregnant: Reunion
programme.desc: Dr. Drew hosts an emotional finale as the teen mothers from the latest series share a stage, coming together with their boyfriends & parents to talk about the issues they face.

programme.title: 16 & Pregnant: Jordan
programme.desc: Jordan and her sister were models and best friends until Jordan's pregnancy put all that on hold. Now her boyfriend and her sister are competing to be her number one.

programme.title: 16 & Pregnant: Jennifer
programme.desc: After abandoning sports and losing her friends, Jennifer has to battle with her over-protective parents to accept her boyfriend before she gives birth to twin boys.

programme.title: 16 & Pregnant: Jamie
programme.desc: Raised by a single mum, Jamie is a straight A student with big plans for the future. But after getting pregnant she struggles to mould her immature boyfriend into the father she never had.

programme.title: Teen Mom 2: Hello From the Other Side
programme.desc: Jade graduates beauty school but family complications threaten her big day. Chelsea guides Aubree as she considers inviting Adam to the Father/Daughter dance. (S10, ep4)

programme.title: Teen Mom 2: Taking Charge
programme.desc: Briana confronts Luis about her STI test results. Jade is forced to support her family after they all lose their jobs. Aubree reconsiders the Father/Daughter dance. (S10, ep5)

programme.title: Teen Mom 2: Where Have You Been?
programme.desc: An explosive family brawl leaves Jade caught between Sean and her parents. DeVoin's family reappears in Briana and Nova's lives after being absent for years. (S10, ep6)

channel.desc: Catch all of your favourite MTV reality shows together on one exclusive channel, MTV Pluto TV. Featuring Catfish, 16 & Pregnant, Teen Mom, Geordie Shore and more!

programme.title: World's Greatest: Water Adventures
programme.desc: We are captivated by oceans, rivers, and lakes - the power, the flow, the reflective stillness. And as we seek to get closer, we immerse ourselves in an expanding range of aquatic experiences.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Sacred Sites
programme.desc: Ancient in architecture and detailed in design, these man-made masterpieces stand as testaments to the strength of human faith. These sites endure as a timeless reminder of resilience, respect, and the need to reflect.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Coasts
programme.desc: Along coasts, one element ends and another begins. No two days are ever the same on a coastline: the only thing that remains a constant is the timeless power of the sea.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Port Cities
programme.desc: Some of the most stunning cities are port cities - Sydney, Rio, Cape Town - and are also some of the most culturally diverse and vibrant. The great maritime cities of the world bridge countries and continents and unite the global community.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Volcanoes
programme.desc: There are few sights on earth as compelling as a volcanic eruption. Volcanoes have the potential to cause death and widespread destruction in a heartbeat, but they also give rise to new life and ecosystems.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Jungle Animals
programme.desc: Encounter gorillas and orangutans, killer tree-dwelling pythons, delightful monkeys, awe-inspiring tigers, and millions of land-dwelling red crabs in Australia, the islands of Southeast Asia, Africa, and the Amazon.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Grassland Animals
programme.desc: Grasslands are the great stages of the natural world where large animals play out spectacular lives in clear view of people, including lions, leopards, elephants, rhinoceros, cheetahs, impalas, kangaroos, wallaby, potoroo, bison, and wolves.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Mega Cities
programme.desc: Mega Cities provide a bustling home to populations of over 10 million. Travel from the high-density living of Shanghai and Bangkok to the sprawling cities of Delhi and Mexico City, each the backdrop for dynamic cultures.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Cruises
programme.desc: There is something seductive about setting sail. Cruises offer us a chance to dip our toes into the 70% of our planet awash with oceans, rivers, and lakes, exploring places that can only be reached by daring to leave the shore.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Mountains
programme.desc: The earth’s fragile crust has folded and faulted, and nowhere are these natural forces more evident than in the world’s great mountains. Explore the highest peaks of the world’s terrain - the rugged realm between heaven and earth.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Marine Animals
programme.desc: From the surprises of colorful reef characters to effervescent penguins, killer sharks, and regal whales, dive into the places where nature reveals itself in some of its most marvelous and bizarre forms.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Coasts
programme.desc: Along coasts, one element ends and another begins. No two days are ever the same on a coastline: the only thing that remains a constant is the timeless power of the sea.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Lost Cities
programme.desc: Once powerful and populous centers of influence, these lost cities are providing clues to how our ancestors existed in the world and remind us that ancient civilizations were not so far removed from our own.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Ancient Cities
programme.desc: In Ancient Cities, we journey to these ancestors of influence such as Luang Prabang, Vienna, and Istanbul where religious and cultural centers have shaped the ways in which we view the world around us and continue to do so in modern times.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Global Cities
programme.desc: Travel to the centers of wealth, power, industry, and innovation. From London to Tokyo, Hong Kong to New York, these are the cities that never sleep. The influence held in these economic hubs unites the global community.

channel.desc: The world is full of inspiring places. World’s Greatest goes on a breathtaking journey around the planet, revealing the best cities, natural wonders, animal encounters, journeys and adventures, monuments, and islands.

programme.title: Arthur: Background Blues/And Now Let's Talk To Some Kids
programme.sub-title: Background Blues/And Now Let's Talk To Some Kids
programme.desc: Wouldn't it be cool to find out that your ancestors were famous frontier explorers? But what if they were just...plain folks? The Magic Toolbox show is coming to Ratburn's class to put the kids on TV!

programme.title: Arthur: Sue Ellen Adds It Up/Wish You Were Here
programme.sub-title: Sue Ellen Adds It Up/Wish You Were Here
programme.desc: Math, schmath. That's what Sue Ellen thinks… until she runs into a problem her artistic vision can't solve. Sue Ellen can't wait to meet her pen pal in person.

programme.title: Arthur: Bully for Binky/Misfortune Teller
programme.desc: Is Binky Barnes really the most disgusting, nasty, horrible person on the planet, or is he just misunderstood? Next, what's got four sides and the answer to everything? Prunella's cootie catcher!

programme.title: Arthur: Two Minutes/Messy Dress Mess
programme.desc: Power shifts in the Tibble household when the twins find out Tommy is two minutes older than Timmy. Ladonna's thrilled when Muffy loans her a beautiful recital dress, but a run-in with a painted bench creates a problem.

programme.title: Arthur: Big Horns George/Bleep
programme.desc: George is inspired to write and perform his own blues song when he's introduced to the music of Koko Taylor. And, D.W. overhears a mysterious word she doesn’t know the meaning of. Can D.W. risk the consequences of blurting out <"BLEEP!">?

programme.title: Arthur: Kids Are From Earth, Parents Are From Pluto/Nerves Of Steal
programme.sub-title: Kids Are From Earth, Parents Are From Pluto/Nerves Of Steal
programme.desc: It’s Lakewood Elementary Parents Open House! How will the kids survive a whole evening of their parents' embarrassing antics? Buster is the only kid in Elwood City who doesn't have a Cybertoy, so he decides to 'borrow' one from the store.

programme.title: Arthur: Whip. Mix. Blend./Staycation
programme.desc: When Rattles's mom starts dating Archie Vanderloo, Rattles finds himself spending time with his twins, but they don’t have anything in common. Arthur offers to babysit so that his parents can enjoy some peace and quiet in the backyard.

programme.title: Arthur: Fifteen
programme.desc: How much can Arthur and his friends do in 15 minutes? Can they all accomplish these missions impossible before the clock counts all the way down? Only time will tell!

programme.title: Arthur: The Chronicles of Buster/On this Spot
programme.sub-title: The Chronicles of Buster/On this Spot
programme.desc: Buster learns that special effects can't take the place of hard work when conquering real mountains. Arthur is thrilled to find out that Sitting Bull once passed through town! He rallies the residents to mark the spot with a monument.

programme.title: Arthur: Elwood City Turns 100!
programme.desc: Arthur and his friends commemorate their 100th episode in style! Mr. Ratburn's class is chosen to stage a musical tribute to Elwood City for its centennial celebration, which quickly becomes a drama behind the curtain!

programme.title: Arthur: The Boy With His Head In The Clouds/More!
programme.sub-title: The Boy With His Head In The Clouds/More!
programme.desc: All the kids know that George is smart--so why does he sometimes have trouble reading and writing? Then, D.W. is thrilled to be getting an allowance. At last, she'll be rich and powerful!

programme.title: Arthur: Caught in the Crosswires/Framed
programme.desc: Muffy is thrilled when mega producer J3 chooses her family for his latest reality TV project. After all, she was born to be star! Buster has just won the best young artist award at the Elwood City Arts Festival.

programme.title: Arthur: He Said, He Said/Bunny Trouble
programme.desc: A special episode of Bionic Bunny is interrupted, and Arthur and friends try to remember what comes next. D.W. is excited to be taking care of the class bunny, Larry. But Larry is feeling adventurous and and wanders off.

programme.title: Arthur: Buenas Noches, Vicita/Prunella Packs It In
programme.sub-title: Buenas Noches, Vicita/Prunella Packs It In
programme.desc: Vicita Molina has lost her favorite bedtime book – can Arthur help her re-create it? Prunella is already starting to think about college! Will she crack under the heavy load or will she learn to relax and do the things she actually enjoys?

programme.title: Arthur: The Cherry Tree/Matchmaker Matchbreaker
programme.desc: Muffy wants a Bouncy Castle at her party, but when her favorite cherry tree is cut down to make room for it, she starts to have regrets. Francine and Muffy scheme to set up their older siblings Chip and Catherine, but plans go awry.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's New Puppy/Arthur Bounces Back
programme.desc: Arthur's new puppy is exactly what he wanted. He's cute and wriggly, and he follows Arthur everywhere. But training a puppy is harder than Arthur thought. Then, a mere $10 stands between Arthur and the shoes he's been dreaming about.

programme.title: Arthur: Love Notes For Muffy/D.W. Blows The Whistle
programme.sub-title: Love Notes For Muffy/D.W. Blows The Whistle
programme.desc: When Muffy tries to bribe the judges at the school science fair, Francine and The Brain plot revenge. And D.W., a newly-deputized Junior Safety Officer, has a reputation for being a strict enforcer of the rules--well, OK, a tattle-tale.

programme.title: Arthur: What Is That Thing?/Buster's Best Behavior
programme.sub-title: What Is That Thing?/Buster's Best Behavior
programme.desc: Arthur and friends are all faced with seemingly impossible tasks, from fixing a model biplane to babysitting D.W. And, Buster knows he's fun, but he's beginning to feel like he's not particularly good at anything.

programme.title: Arthur: Get Smart/Baby Steps
programme.desc: Everyone loves HUGO--the new interactive whiteboard that claims to be 100% accurate. If only Mr. Ratburn knew how to use it. Mei Lin can say "hello" AND play the piano?!? Kate can't even wave!

programme.title: Arthur: D.W. Rides Again/Arthur Makes The Team
programme.sub-title: D.W. Rides Again/Arthur Makes The Team
programme.desc: In D.W.’s heart lurks one big, gnawing desire--TO GET RID OF THOSE TRAINING WHEELS! Then, can Coach Frensky work with a baseball team where everyone is fighting about who gets to be pitcher and no one wants to practice?

programme.title: Arthur's First Day
programme.desc: It's finally the first day of fourth grade and Arthur couldn't be more excited - until he learns Buster is in another class! Meanwhile, D.W. is nervous for her first day of kindergarten. Will Arthur and D.W. be able to make new friends?

programme.title: Arthur: Portrait of the Artist as a Young Tibble/The Secret Guardians
programme.sub-title: Portrait of the Artist as a Young Tibble/The Secret Guardians
programme.desc: The Tibble Twins start a new business to earn enough money to buy the coveted Krummy Kreepy Kastle. When and friends stumble upon a beautiful woodland oasis right by their homes, they vow to tell no one and keep it as their secret spot.

programme.title: Arthur: Fernlets by Fern/Prunella and the Haunted Locker
programme.sub-title: Fernlets by Fern/Prunella and the Haunted Locker
programme.desc: Muffy talks Fern into writing poems for a new line of greeting cards which becomes the hit of Elwood City, but booming business causes Fern to burn out. Prunella is assigned a new school locker, which is rumored to be haunted!

programme.title: Arthur: Molina's Mulligan/Buster Bombs
programme.desc: Alberto discovers he has a natural talent for golf and begins to compete, but will his dad's embarrassing cheers make him give it up? Buster has lost his flair for funny, and the harder he tries to make people laugh, the worse it gets.

programme.title: Arthur: What's Cooking?/Buster's Special Delivery
programme.desc: Celebrity chef Ming Tsai is judging Lakewood Elementary's first-ever cooking contest, and Arthur thinks he has a shot at winning. Then, Buster volunteers to deliver the school mail and finds out that his new job is actually hard work!

channel.desc: Based on the beloved books by Marc Brown, these are the adventures of Arthur, an 8-year-old aardvark, and his family and friends as they grow up and learn how to be good neighbours to one another.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Pearl Harbor (December 7, 1941)
programme.desc: During a two-hour surprise attack on the American Pacific fleet anchored at Pearl Harbor, Japanese navy pilots score a near-complete victory.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Fall of the Philippines
programme.desc: Examining the Japanese invasion of the Philippines in December 1941.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: The Battle of Midway (June 2, 1942)
programme.desc: Only one isolated atoll prevents an enemy invasion of Hawaii. Midway Island is where the Japanese fleet converges on a tiny American base with a massive strafing and bombing attack.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: The Solomon Islands (July 1942)
programme.desc: For the first time since Americans entered the war, Marines face Japanese infantrymen at Guadal Canal. In the jungles, two powerful armies clash in a six month battle that claims nearly 30,000 lives.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Battle of Dieppe
programme.desc: The Allies launch an ill-fated attack on the German-occupied port of Dieppe, France.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Battle of Stalingrad
programme.desc: German forces encounter Russian resistance.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: El Alamein
programme.desc: Erwin Rommel battles Allied forces in North Africa in 1942.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: North Africa (November 1942)
programme.desc: In the North African desert in 1942, American fighting forces encounter the dreaded Rommel for the first time to stop the German war machine.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Burma: The Forgotten Front (Spring 1943)
programme.desc: The Japanese meet resistance from British forces as they advance through Burma to take India in 1944.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Battle of Sicily
programme.desc: Fresh from victory in North Africa, the Allies successfully invade the island of Sicily, staging an eventual Italian withdrawal from the war.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Bombing of Ploesti
programme.desc: American bombers target a Romanian oil refinery in a daring 1943 mission.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Monte Cassino (September 3, 1943)
programme.desc: As the allies make their way into Italy, they encounter tremendous resistance at German defensive positions along the Gustav line. One of these locations is an ancient monastery called Monte Cassino.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: The Gilbert Islands (November 1943)
programme.desc: Bloody fighting erupts on a group of tiny Pacific islands in November 1943.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Battle of Anzio
programme.desc: Allied armies encounter German resistance in the Italian fishing town of Anzio.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Kwajalein
programme.desc: Examining the battle at the Kwajelein Atoll in the South Pacific during 1944. Included: operations by the Seabees.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Battle in Palau (Summer 1944)
programme.desc: As the United States prepared for the invasion of the Philippines, scheduled for late 1944, the tiny Palau Islands had to be taken first.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: D-Day (June 6,1944)
programme.desc: D-Day, the 6th of June--one of the most pivotal moments in world history. In a massive armada of thousands of ships, 3,000,000 allied troops land at Three Beaches in Normandy, France.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Retaking France
programme.desc: Six weeks after the D-Day invasion of the Beaches of Normandy, the allied forces are pushing the Germans back through the French countryside. Town by town is won back as Panzer divisions retreat back to the Meuse River.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Operation Dragoon (August 1944)
programme.desc: The Allies break into France and push the Germans back to their own border.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Liberation of the Paris
programme.desc: Both political and military expediency were factors in the return of the French capital to its people.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Arnhem
programme.desc: The Allies launch an attack designed to push the Germans back to the Rhine River.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory
programme.desc: Gen. Douglas MacArthur's return to the Philippines, and the final push to retake the islands after two years of Japanese occupation.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: The Last Stronghold (November 1944)
programme.desc: American B-29 high-altitude bomber attacks Japan near the end of World War II.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Mount Belvedere
programme.desc: The Battle of the Gothic Line in 1944.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Battle of the Bulge (December 1944)
programme.desc: The December 1944 battle pitting American forces against German Panzer divisions in the Ardennes Forest.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Mount Hot Rocks (February 19, 1945)
programme.desc: American forces landing on the shores of Iwo Jima encounter Japanese combatants willing to fight to the death.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Battle of Remagen
programme.desc: German forces retreat across the Rhine on the Remagen bridge near the close of the war.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Battle of Okinawa
programme.desc: Kamikaze pilots guard the island of Okinawa from American forces.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Fall of Berlin
programme.desc: In 1945, Soviet and American troops press Hitler's armies from the west and the east, culminating in the fall of Berlin.

programme.title: Battlefront: WWII Road To Victory: Commerce Raiders
programme.desc: Heavily armed vessels disguised as ordinary cargo ships patrolled allied waters, sinking supply boats and stealing their content.

channel.desc: Look behind the important battles, daring bombing raids, and devastating amounts of bloodshed that helped shape British history. Watch key events as you’ve never seen before in colourised archive footage providing new windows into the past.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Harold & Armani
programme.desc: Harold found his match with a beautiful fellow jock named Armani. Although they live in the same area, they've never met. Nev is joined by Angel Haze to help Harold get his perfect girl.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: David is the only love Andria has ever known. Love letters and voice messages make Andria stay. But having never met after 10 years, she needs to know what he is hiding that keeps him away.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Sunny & Jamison
programme.desc: Sunny is in love with the man of her dreams. Jamison is a model, a TV writer, and also studying to be an anaesthesiologist. However, the pair have never met. Is Jamison too good to be true? (S1, ep1)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Dorion & Jeszica
programme.desc: Dorion is about to give up everything for online love Jeszica, including his relationship with girlfriend Raffinee. But first he wants to know, is Jeszica really the girl in the pictures? (S2, ep5)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Antoinette & Albert
programme.desc: A year after meeting 'T-lights' on Instagram, 'instaceleb' Antoinette is ready to meet him, but he always brushes off the idea. Is he really the online celebrity he claims to be?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Falesha & Jacqueline
programme.desc: Falesha's name and pictures were stolen by a fake profile that nearly ruined her life. She thought her troubles were behind her, but four years later her past comes back to haunt her.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Anthony & Marq
programme.desc: Anthony is a war veteran who wears his heart on his sleeve. Over a year ago, he bonded online with a caring man named Marq. Today, they're head over heels in love - but what is Marq hiding? (S2, ep2)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Lucille & Kidd Cole
programme.desc: Lucille led a simple life until she was asked to work for music producer Kidd Cole. Companies were never paid and one day Kidd couldn't be found. Will she get the answers she needs? (S3, ep4)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Brittany finds love online with Bryon, a marine who may get deployed again to Iraq, she seeks Nev and Max's help before she runs out of time to discover if the perfect military man is real.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Anthony & Marq
programme.desc: Anthony is a war veteran who wears his heart on his sleeve. Over a year ago, he bonded online with a caring man named Marq. Today, they're head over heels in love - but what is Marq hiding?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Felipe & Jasmine
programme.desc: Single father Felipe is ready to settle down with Jasmine. However, the two have been talking online for eight months and have never met. Max returns and joins Nev to investigate. (S4, ep6)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Aaliyah & Alicia
programme.desc: Aaliyah has been able to share her life struggles with Alicia. However, despite living only 70 blocks away, Alicia refuses to meet her as she hasn't come out to her friends and family yet.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Antwane & Tony
programme.desc: Nev and Max are contacted by Carmen who is sounding the alarm on behalf of her cousin, Antwane. He's been in a three-year romance with a man named Tony that he met on a telephone chat line.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Craig & Zoe
programme.desc: Craig's sister introduced him to a beautiful girl named Zoe on Facebook. After talks online of a future life together, things turn sour. Now he wants to know who he gave his heart to.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Devan & Rylan
programme.desc: For shy Devan, meeting Rylan was love at first click. Devan wants to believe that Rylan is marriage material but her suspicious behaviour is leaving him with doubts. (S4, ep18)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Blaire & Markie
programme.desc: When Blaire's Instagram lover Markie broke her heart, she moved on. But now Markie is back and wants to meet. Blaire needs Nev and Max's help to make it happen and reveal Markie's secret. (S4, ep9)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Rod & Ebony
programme.desc: Rod met Ebony on a dating web site four years ago, now it's time for the two to meet in person. Is Ebony who she says she is? What will happen when they meet in real life for the first time?

channel.desc: Catfish: The TV Show" tackles the mystery and complexities of dating in a digital world. Nev Schulman and Max Joseph take viewers on a journey that goes inside the stories of young people as their online-only romantic relationships collide with real-life.

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Should We Just Break Up?

programme.title: The Patriot
programme.desc: A respected doctor must race against time to find a cure for a lethal virus, unleashed by a paramilitary militia leader. Starring: Steven Seagal, L.Q. Jones, Gailard Sartain, Camilla Belle, Brad Leland

programme.title: ShockWave: Countdown to Disaster
programme.desc: A stolen seismic weapon is activated in Yemen. A hostage freed there tries in vain to warn against it's global effect. It starts seismic activity at the Californian fault line where her daughter and ex are monitoring it. Can they stop it?

programme.title: The Shooter
programme.desc: A CIA agent gets caught up in political intrigue after he gets brought in to solve the murder of a Cuban ambassador.

programme.title: Reprisal
programme.desc: A veteran looks to raise money for his son's healthcare by teaming up with another vet to track down criminals.

programme.title: Triple Cross: Triple Cross
programme.desc: During WW2, convicted bank robber Eddie Chapman becomes a triple agent working for both the British and the Germans.

programme.title: Relic Hunter: Fountain of Youth
programme.desc: While Nigel rehearses his keynote speech in a Seville hotel room, a girl nearly breaks his nose demanding something - it turns out she was after the water from the Fountain of Youth.

programme.title: Relic Hunter: Arthur's Cross
programme.desc: Scotland Yard calls Sidney and Nigel to identify a 5th century murder weapon. It turns out to be the burial cross of King Arthur, but besides the victim several others are looking for it.

programme.title: Relic Hunter: So Shall It Be
programme.desc: When Sidney and Nigel are about to enter the site of a Bristol lecture, a young author approaches them to follow up immediately on a tip about a map to the lost keys to the druid cult in Stonehenge.

programme.title: Relic Hunter: Buddha's Bowl
programme.desc: Sydney and Nigel head to Nepal to recover Buddha's fabled overflowing alms bowl for villagers who are building a shrine to the original Buddha.

programme.title: Relic Hunter: The Headless Nun
programme.desc: When Sydney's plane crashes, she's asked by a group of nuns to find the head of another nun who was decapitated several centuries ago.

programme.title: Relic Hunter: Smoking Gun
programme.desc: Sydney and Nigel search for Al Capone's diamond-encrusted gun at the behest of a man hoping it will clear his grandfather of a murder he was framed for.

channel.desc: It’s time to go into overdrive by jumping off buildings, flying a burning plane, driving in a car chase and saving the world. Pluto TV Action brings you blockbusters, stars, and a strong dose of high-octane excitement.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Playing With Fire
programme.desc: In September 2002, two men were found executed in a burning Mercedes in an upscale Hollywood neighborhood. What initially looked like a drug-related murder, turned out to be something entirely different, but the crime scene left little evidence to go on.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Dirty Little Secrets
programme.desc: In April 2006, Matt Baker, a pastor from Waco, Texas, returned home to find his wife Kari unconscious, with an empty bottle of Unisom and a suicide note beside her. Police ruled it a suicide. However, her family believed otherwise.

programme.title: 48 Hours: fugitive@hotmail.com
programme.desc: A report on the three-year manhunt and eventual capture of Dr. Yazeed “Yaz” Essa, a Cleveland doctor accused of murdering his wife, Rosemarie. In February 2005, weeks after Rosemarie’s death, tests proved that she had died of cyanide poisoning.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Hunt for Mr. Wright
programme.desc: A report on George Wright, who was sentenced to prison for the 1962 murder of New Jersey service station owner Walter Patterson, and who after spending 8 years in prison, escaped, and spent 40 years on the run from the authorities.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Chasing the Barefoot Bandit
programme.desc: A report on Colton Harris-Moore, also known as the “Barefoot Bandit,” because of his habit of committing crimes barefoot and leaving chalk outlines of his feet; and whose exploits included stealing planes, guns, yachts, and escaping to foreign countries.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Secrets, Lies and Alibis
programme.desc: John and Susan Sutton were sleeping in separate rooms in their Florida home, when a gunman entered their house and shot both of them several times. Susan was killed, but John survived. Nothing was taken from the house, proving the murder premeditated.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Long Island Serial Killer
programme.desc: A report on the disappearance of Shannan Gilbert, near Gilgo Beach, New York. The search for Shannan led to the discovery of a total of ten bodies in the scrub brush of Gilgo Beach, leading police to suspect the work of a serial killer.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Live to Tell: Hunting Humans
programme.desc: In July 2007, Shea McDonough returned home and left the back door open for her brother, not knowing he wasn’t coming home for the night. Hours later, when her father went to her room to check on her, he saw a masked man standing over her with a knife.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Every Picture Tells A Story
programme.desc: On February 15, 2009, Cathy McNaughton was stabbed to death in her home in Sharpsburg, Georgia. The day had started with her husband Alec serving her breakfast in bed.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Death Wish
programme.desc: A report surrounding the July 2009 death of Jeffrey Locker, whose body was found slumped over the steering wheel of his car in Harlem, New York. When authorities tracked Locker’s ATM card to Kenneth Minor, Minor said Locker had begged Minor to kill him.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Sweetheart Murders
programme.desc: The story of sweethearts Sabrina Gonsalves and John Riggins who were brutally murdered in Davis, California, in 1980. Initially, police suspected Gerald Gallego, but he was in jail at the time of the murders.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Year We Disappeared
programme.desc: In August 1979, John Busby, a Falmouth, Massachusetts police officer, was ambushed in his car by a gunman in a passing car who shot him in the face. Although wounded, Busby was able to write a note for police at the scene that said “Not an accident.”

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Stranger You Know
programme.desc: A report about Marti Hill, who was savagely beaten in her Prairie Village, Kansas home. She was found by police barely breathing and covered in blood.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Over the Edge
programme.desc: A report on the investigation into the 2009 disappearance of Dawn Viens, and why her husband, California chef David Viens, jumped off a cliff when he became a suspect in her disappearance.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Pain and Gain
programme.desc: A report about the crimes of the Sun Gym gang, a group of Miami, Florida drifters, petty thieves, and bodybuilders who kidnapped and killed wealthy people to fuel their lifestyle.

programme.title: 48 Hours: AKA Rockefeller
programme.desc: Authorities suspect a con man who has used many different identities may be a murderer.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Ambushed
programme.desc: A man helps a new detective figure out who murdered his father.

channel.desc: Pluto TV 48 Hours brings viewers behind the scenes of the most intriguing murders. Follow the investigators, meet the accused, and review the evidence in the original true crime docuseries, with stories of obsession, revenge, and crimes of passion.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: A World of Friends
programme.desc: The children learn about many different countries while experiencing an "International Fair" on the playground.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop forgets to say "please" and "thank you". Riff shares his dream of becoming an inventor.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: The Big Garden - Get Happy
programme.desc: Baby Bop wants Barney, BJ and the kids to play with her instead of working in their garden. They promise to play with her as soon as they finish. Baby Bop can't wait, and tries many ways to get them to come play with her now, none of which work.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Sharing Is Caring!
programme.desc: The children bring toys to donate to Mr. Boyd's toy drive. Baby Bop and BJ arrive and after some convincing, Baby Bop learns about the merits of sharing.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: A Wonderful World of Colors and Shapes
programme.sub-title: A Wonderful World of Colors and Shapes
programme.desc: Picture this! When Barney shows off his new painting, his friends are inspired to create their own art show. Discovering how to create new colors and draw shapes, Barney and his friends put on a super-dee-duper art show

programme.title: Barney and Friends: This Way In, This Way Out!
programme.sub-title: This Way In, This Way Out!
programme.desc: Angela is in the park to release her turtle after observing him with her classmates in school. Barney and the children discuss the meaning of in and out after observing the turtle going in and out of his shell.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Here Kitty, Kitty
programme.desc: When Miss Jo loses her cat, Barney and the children spend the day helping her find it. Along the way, they learn all about cats.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: My Friends the Doctor
programme.desc: Time for a check-up! Barney helps his friends discover the world of doctors and dentists as they learn about healthy habits like brushing teeth, getting checkups, eating healthy foods and getting exercise.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Tea-riffic Manners
programme.desc: A tea party planned by the children turns into a fun opportunity to reinforce lessons about good manners! Throughout the day, Baby Bop is given helpful advice.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Three kids try to build a pretend farm with disastrous results because they won't work together. Barney and his friends try to cheer up Olivia.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Everybody's Got Feelings
programme.desc: Barney helps Baby Bop and BJ learn that everyone has feelings—happy, sad, angry—and sometimes all those feelings can be experienced in just one day.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Home Safe Home
programme.desc: Safety first! After learning about fire safety when a firefighter visits the caboose, Barney and his friends are inspired to do a little "safety inspection" of their own.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop is disappointed when their trip to the zoo is postponed. Barney tells Baby Bop a tale about keeping your promise.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney helps BJ see that we don't forget old friends when we make new ones. Ryan and his Grandpa have a great day in the Park.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop meets a new girl named Jill who doesn’t want to join the fun.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When Riff is asked to be captain of a baseball team, he doesn’t think he can do it. But Barney gives him the courage to try.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Big As Barney - The Chase
programme.desc: When Ryan notices how much everyone loves Barney, he tries to be just like him; but he has a hard time filling Barney's shoes. Then Ryan learns that he is special when he's just being himself!

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Numbers! Numbers!
programme.desc: Tony shares a box full of numbers that he made with his dad. He is showing them off when a gust of wind blows them all away. Barney and the kids decide to go on a number hunt. They soon find Baby Bop and their hunt takes the group all over the park.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: It's A Happy Day!
programme.desc: Beth has invented a brand-new holiday called "Happy Day," in which everyone gets to make a wish for something which will make them happy—and everyone else tries to make that wish come true! Barney and the kids discuss feelings and facial expressions.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Ahora Mismo!
programme.desc: When Ben arrives too late to get a pony ride he must learn how to wait the hard way. He's always wanted a horse and now it looks as if he's missed his opportunity. Luckily, Barney takes him to Spain where they meet Regalo, a dancing horse!

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: BJ’s efforts to decorate the park go awry when he accidentally paints the caboose several different colors. Baby Bop can’t wait for BJ and Riff to go on their camping trip.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop is sad because she lost her pet caterpillar, Monty. Barney and the others try to help her find it./Barney and Baby Bop are thrilled when BJ sets up a bug zoo in the caboose.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: A Fountain of Fun
programme.desc: While Barney and the children wait for Mr. Boyd's new fountain to be delivered, they have fun playing in and exploring the park.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Big Brother Rusty
programme.desc: Barney's excited to find out that Rusty's family is adopting a new baby girl from China; however, Rusty feels differently. He's not sure if he's going to be a good brother, and he doesn't know much about China.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Coming on Strong
programme.desc: Exercise is good for everybody and every body! From running to touching toes to jumping jacks to some favorite songs and games, Barney and his friends grow strong while having fun with exercise.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: When some of the children in the park invite Barney to join them for a race./When BJ starts to feel sick after eating too many sweets, he lies down in hopes of feeling better.

channel.desc: Join Barney & Friends for adventures, songs, dancing and lots of fun every day on Pluto TV. In Barney's world, sharing and caring are key!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Hot Wheels
programme.desc: '70s sand rail dune racer with rally hemi heads; 1965 replica Mustang pool table; off-road racing gear.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Allen's Got Balls
programme.desc: After returning to LA, Ton & Allen head deep into hostile auction hunter territory and butt heads with a familiar old foe! They discover a driving range golf ball picker vehicle and one of the most accurate rifles ever made!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Fire in the Hole!
programme.desc: 1930s "blasting machine" dynamite detonator box; 1890s treasure chest with secret compartments. Ton smelts jewelry to forge bricks of silver.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Night of the Digging Dead
programme.desc: A custom-built shark cage; 1900s pathologist's dissection toolkit; 1940s embalming pump and one of the first electric bone saws.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: The Jersey Score
programme.desc: Ton & Allen attend a silent auction in NJ, but that doesn't stop the local buyers from letting them know they're not welcome! They uncover a skeet throwing machine from the 1960's & a vintage vehicle with some real horsepower!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: High Flying Ton
programme.desc: A nerdy auction buyer tests Ton and Allen's patience at a big container auction in Ventura. The guys discover a basket and burners for a hot air balloon and a 19th century German single shot rifle!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Big Easy Money
programme.desc: Allen & Ton head to New Orleans in search of easy money, but instead encounter some bayou bidders with big-time bucks! They discover a pair of early 19th-century dueling pistols & a vintage airboat fitted with a turbine engine!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Miami Heat
programme.desc: All-terrain Air Commander Hovercraft, a 1970s NASA countdown clock and a one-of-a-kind 1960s Delta Relay rocket.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Ice, Ice, Baby
programme.desc: Ton and Allen have to get aggressive when they encounter a towering opponent with a mountain of cash. The guys uncover a vintage ice resurfacing machine and an Olympic biathlon rifle!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Sidecar Surprise
programme.desc: An unassuming mom in an oversized sweater tries to pull the wool over Ton & Allen's eyes at a storage auction in Arlington, VA. The guys uncover a black powder cannon designed in the 15th century & a Russian military motorcycle!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Diesel Digs
programme.desc: The guys head to the industrial hub of LA to score some heavy machinery and unearth a 1981 Bobcat 743 Frontloader, one of the first powered by a diesel engine and a trench-defending WWI German Sturmtrupp helmet bashing mace.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Cold Hard Cash
programme.desc: Ton and Allen go North to Alaska and get a cold reception from the local auctioneer. They find two enormous seaplane pontoons and a pair of Smith & Wesson revolvers, including the most powerful production handgun in the world!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Home on the Gun Range
programme.desc: Barely making it to an auction in Corona, CA, Allen and Ton buy an overstuffed unit and find an antique crossbow, a rare 10-gauge Winchester shotgun and a 1940s Kiss-o-Meter.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Voodoo Moola
programme.desc: Allen & Ton hit a storage auction in Louisiana's Capitol City and quickly find themselves in trouble with the law! The guys uncover a pair of racing lawnmowers and then stumble on an antique barber chair from the early 1900s!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Half Pipe Dreams
programme.desc: 1970s Z-Flex Jimmy Plumer Poolrider skateboard with artwork by Doug Smith; Kevlar bulletproof vest, ballistic facemask and a helmet used by S.W.A.T. teams; a pair of 1990s racing pocket bikes capable of going 80 mph.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Friends in Hawaii Places
programme.desc: Allen &Ton enlist an assistant, Carolyn, and Allen's Hawaiian buddy, Junior, to help them battle local buyers. The guys find a WWII-era motor scooter and a stash of antique Polynesian tattoo tools that get used on Ton!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Labor of Love
programme.desc: Harley Davidson V-twin EVO engine and revolutionary 1958 dual-suspension swingarm frame; '80s Ms. Pac-Man arcade machine; rare Air Jordan vintage shoe collection in mint condition.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Strat'ed for Cash
programme.desc: On a limited budget in the historic L.A. neighborhood of West Adams, Allen and Ton still win three lockers and find a Maui Blue Fender Stratocaster and a 1930s Schwinn bike.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Hidden Hot Wheels
programme.desc: Ton and Allen challenge a big time auction buyer on his home turf. The guys uncover a 1969 Chevelle Malibu muscle car and a single-shot pistol designed to aid Allied resistance fighters during WWII.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Mr. Haff Goes to Washington
programme.desc: Ton and Allen invade the Nation's capital, but meet strong resistance from local bidders. The guys uncover a Civil War era black powder revolver and a stash of South African gold coins!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Battle Bought
programme.desc: Mint 1800s French "Harmonica Pistol" and a collection of '90s remote controlled combat robots.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Ton's Hot Commodity
programme.desc: Allen is late to the auction, leaving Ton to battle a feisty female auction buyer on his own! The guys find a fully functional flamethrower and a rare hand-carved bow and arrow set from South America!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Top Gun Ton
programme.desc: Scale RC Viper FanJet aircraft with a potent jet engine; 1920s Gundlach Korona large format field camera used for photography expeditions. Ton pilots a plane, but crashes and burns.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Beantown Bidders
programme.desc: 1800s blackpowder whaling harpoon; 1940s Schwinn Town & Country tandem bicycle; a vintage American flag collection that could be worth thousands.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Shuffle
programme.desc: Ton and Allen teach a cocky new auction hunter a lesson. They spot a 1940's-era shuffleboard table and uncover an early hot rod made from the fuel tank of a WWII fighter plane!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Sin City Shootout
programme.desc: 1953 Chevy-inspired bumper car; scores of M16 30-round magazines; reproduction 1940s boardwalk photobooth; aerosol-powered spud gun potato launchers.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Gangster Whiskey
programme.desc: Allen and Ton trek to an auction in Moreno Valley, CA, where two locker wins yield a vintage jukebox, a valuable baseball card and a Prohibition-era moonshine still.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: Ton and Allen duke it out with a local thrift store gang at a Brooklyn storage auction. The guys discover a classic arcade redemption game and a mid-century water cannon designed to fight towering infernos!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Ton's Driller Instinct
programme.desc: Ton & Allen encounter aggressive outdoorsmen in the Alaskan wilderness. The guys discover an 8-wheeled ATV that travels on both land & water and an air percussion hammer that can drill through solid rock!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Everything's Bigger in Texas
programme.desc: Winchester 1886 rifle invented to kill buffalo; collection of 1950s electric Slot Cars.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Quadzilla Attacks!
programme.desc: Extreme Quadzilla ATV, the fastest 4 wheeler ever; a 1910s Remington Derringer and an 1880s Palm Squeezer pistol; revolutionary 1800s Western Electric telephone with a crank dial.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: The Wild West
programme.desc: Allen and Ton explain their strategies at a storage auction in San Bernardino, win two units, then have a Pepperbox gun and vintage Lionel train set appraised by experts.

channel.desc: Finding everything from vintage vending machines to rare guitars to antique firearms, expert storage locker buyers Allen and Ton travel to auctions across Southern California, bidding on abandoned units they can quickly flip for a tidy profit.

programme.title: Teen Mom UK: Emotions And Explosions

programme.title: Teen Mom UK: Happy Ever After

programme.sub-title: Finale Special: Check Up With Dr. Drew Part 2

programme.title: Teen Mom

programme.title: Teen Mom
programme.desc: Maci decides to enrol Bentley in day care while Amber prepares to go to rehab. Catelynn and Tyler celebrate Carly's second birthday, and Farrah has a change of heart. (S4, ep1)

programme.title: Teen Mom
programme.desc: Catelynn and Tyler have an emotional visit with their daughter, Amber struggles during her first weeks of rehab and Farrah says farewell to her life in Iowa. (S4, ep2)

programme.title: Teen Mom
programme.desc: Catelynn and Tyler attend their high school graduation. Maci considers joining Ryan on his family vacation. Farrah has to deal with her parents' overbearing concerns. (S4, ep3)

programme.title: Teen Mom
programme.desc: Gary and Leah visit Amber in rehab and Farrah goes on a date with her neighbour. Maci joins Ryan's family vacation and Catelynn and Tyler question letting Butch move back into their home. (S4, ep4)

programme.title: Teen Mom
programme.desc: Amber and Gary work on their relationship issues. Maci struggles to choose classes. Visiting her parents, Farrah is annoyed with their concerns for Sophia. (S4, ep5)

channel.desc: `Teen Mom' chronicles the challenges teenagers Farrah, Maci, Amber and Catelynn face in their first years of motherhood, including such things as graduating from high school, relationships, getting a job, beginning college and moving out on their own.

programme.title: 16 & Pregnant: Catelynn
programme.desc: Catelynn and Tyler both have very dramatic home lives, and it gets even more complicated when Catelynn falls pregnant. They have some important choices to make, but can they cope?

programme.title: 16 & Pregnant: Life After Labour
programme.desc: In this special episode Dr. Drew Pinsky discusses each girl's episode, issues and challenges and update us on what's going on now. There will also be questions from viewers and the audience.

programme.desc: Lizzie's pregnancy forces her to drop out of high school and the marching band. She looks to her boyfriend Skylar for support... until she discovers he hasn't always been faithful.

programme.title: 16 & Pregnant: Kailyn

programme.title: 16 & Pregnant: Brooke

programme.title: 16 & Pregnant: Felicia

programme.title: 16 & Pregnant: Emily

channel.desc: Young women share their personal journeys as they cope with the challenges and mounting responsibilities of unexpected motherhood.

programme.title: CSI: NY: Admissions

programme.title: CSI: NY: Personal Foul

programme.title: CSI: NY: Taxi

programme.title: CSI: NY: Hostage

programme.title: CSI: NY: Veritas
programme.desc: The bank robbery saga from last season continues as Mac seeks revenge after nearly being killed by the mysterious Joe.

programme.title: CSI: NY: Page Turner
programme.desc: A free street concert quickly turns into a crime scene, the victim, in this case, has been mysteriously plagued with radiation.

programme.title: CSI: NY: Turbulence

programme.title: CSI: NY: Sex, Lies and Silicone
programme.desc: A very powerful woman in the world of politics is found dead leaving many desperate in hoping that her information does not get leaked out.

programme.title: CSI: NY: The Cost of Living
programme.desc: The CSIs investigate the death of a young archaeologist who may have unearthed the answer to one of New York City's oldest murder mysteries.

programme.title: CSI: New York: Personal Foul
programme.desc: As the search for the "Cabbie Killer" continues, riding a cab gets very deadly. The team must figure out how to keep New York City safe.

programme.title: CSI: New York: Veritas
programme.desc: Immediately following the previous season finale, the team is investigating the death of a woman named Lauren Salinas who is linked to the bank robbery. She turns out to be a friend of Flack's sister Samantha.

programme.title: CSI: New York: Page Turner
programme.desc: When two people turn up dead with radiation poisoning, it sparks an urgent investigation before it turns into a deadly outbreak in New York City when it's tracked down to a book at the NYC Library.

programme.title: CSI: New York: Turbulence
programme.desc: When an Air Marshal turns up dead on a flight on which Mac is a passenger, the victim it turns out, isn't a Marshal at all. The real Marshal was killed earlier and his ID stolen.

programme.title: CSI: New York: Sex, Lies, and Silicone
programme.desc: When a prominent journalist named Ann Steele turns up dead at a street party, the investigation leads the team to a life-size silicone doll company.

programme.title: CSI: New York: Dead Inside

programme.title: CSI: New York: My Name Is Mac Taylor
programme.desc: When two men who share the same name as detective Mac Taylor are killed, detective Taylor rounds up all the other Mac Taylors in New York and tries to figure out who will be the next victim.

channel.desc: Forensic scientists and investigators of the New York City Police Department unveil the circumstances behind mysterious and unusual deaths.

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Tunnel Vision
programme.desc: A body in a sinkhole leads Horatio and the CSI team to a robbery, while investigating they discover the target holds a shocking secret.

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Rock and a Hard Place

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Down To the Wire
programme.desc: When a man is killed due to a fake 911 call, Horatio must face off with a private investigator who is systematically destroying the team.

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Going Ballistic
programme.desc: When someone is determined to take down Horatio and the CSI team, Horatio puts his life on the line in order to save his team.

programme.title: CSI: Miami: From The Grave
programme.desc: Horatio and the CSI team face off with Miami’s notorious and deadly Mala Noche gang after a funeral becomes the scene of a murder.

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Blood in The Water
programme.desc: A family boating accident reveals a sinister plot by grifters to heist 10 million dollars in gold bars. Horatio and the CSI team investigate.

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Prey

programme.title: CSI: Miami: 48 Hours to Life

programme.desc: A horrible car accident that claims the life of a woman turns out to be a murder case. During the investigation Natalia confesses a secret history of marital abuse in order to help the case to be solved.

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Driven

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Free Fall

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Dead Air

programme.title: CSI: Miami: CSI Trilogy: Shock

programme.title: CSI: Miami: CSI Trilogy: One of Our Own
programme.sub-title: CSI Trilogy: One of Our Own
programme.desc: Horatio and Delko search Miami to bring down the Mala Noche gang once and for all. The quest to end the crime-spree is jeopardized when Federal agents, led by Agent Glen Cole, raid the CSI lab searching for missing cash evidence, based on an unknown tip.

channel.desc: Follow Horatio Caine, a former homicide detective, and his team of Miami-Dade Police Department forensic scientists as they try to unveil the conditions behind the mysterious deaths and crimes.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers: Frozen Carnage
programme.desc: Manley Hot Springs, Alaska is a remote mountain hide-a-way known for its solitude. That innocent existence is shattered when a newcomer goes on a rampage and guns down residents one by one.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers: Guns, Gold and Murder
programme.desc: Police are met with a myriad of theories when a well-known gold miner and political activist vanishes without a trace. Was it an alien abduction, a government conspiracy or cold-blooded murder?

programme.desc: The Charles Manson story is told via Manson Family members, victims’ families, witnesses, prosecutors, reporters, authors, and Manson in his own words detailing the horror of the vicious attacks.

programme.title: Very Scary People: Charles Manson: The Devil’s Work (Part 2)
programme.desc: The Charles Manson story is told via Manson Family members, victims’ families, witnesses, prosecutors, reporters, authors, and Manson in his own words detailing the horror of the vicious attacks.

programme.title: Very Scary People: John Wayne Gacy: Evil Secret (Part 1)
programme.desc: John Wayne Gacy lead a double life in the 1970s. By day, Gacy was a community leader and part time clown, by night, he transformed into a monster who chose young male teens as his prey.

programme.title: Very Scary People: John Wayne Gacy: Evil Secret (Part 2)
programme.desc: John Wayne Gacy lead a double life in the 1970s. By day, Gacy was a community leader and part time clown, by night, he transformed into a monster who chose young male teens as his prey.

programme.title: Sins & Secrets: Kansas City

programme.title: Sins & Secrets: Palm Beach
programme.desc: In 2009, Mike Dippolito was found shot in his Palm Beach home. Suddenly his wife, Dalia, became a trophy widow. Only a surprise confession would reveal the bizarre truth about Mike’s murder.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Settle the Score
programme.desc: When Johnny Crawford is killed in his easy chair, police are perplexed to learn he may have been shot over a musical instrument. It soon becomes clear the young man wasn’t killed for his own sins.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: The Line Goes Dead
programme.desc: When the severed head of a wife and mother is found, Lt. Joe Kenda uses forensics and interrogation to find both her body and her killer.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Bring My Baby Home

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: My, My, Merry Christmas
programme.desc: Donald Ott is found shot to death, friends tell police he didn’t have an enemy in the world. But when Lt. Joe Kenda speaks with family, he learns of a relative who might hold the key to the mystery.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: My First Case
programme.desc: In his first case with the homicide unit, rookie burglary detective Joe Kenda volunteers to work a bloody multi-victim shooting deemed “unsolvable” by the veterans.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Death Rains Down

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Death Grip

channel.desc: Aftershock’s Crime channel brings some of the world’s most must-watch true crime series together, keeping you glued to the screen with all their shocking twists and turns.

programme.title: The Odd Couple: Secret Agent Man

programme.title: The Millers: Giving The Bird

programme.title: The Millers: Driving Miss Crazy

programme.title: The Millers: Internet Dating

programme.title: The Millers: You're In Trouble

programme.desc: When Carol finds out that Tom never had "the talk" with Nathan about the birds and the bees, she insists it's not too late to gather the family together and do it now.

programme.title: The Millers: Carol's Parents Are Coming to Town
programme.sub-title: Carol's Parents Are Coming to Town
programme.desc: When Carol's overbearing mother and father announce they're coming to visit for Christmas, Carol recruits Nate and Tom to cover up their failed relationships and present a happy facade.

programme.title: The Millers: Dear Diary

programme.title: The Millers: Miller's Mind

programme.title: The Millers: Carol's Surprise

programme.title: The Millers: You Betcha
programme.desc: Nathan asks Tom to spend the weekend with him in the hopes of finding something they have in common.

programme.title: The Millers: Bahama Mama
programme.desc: Just as Nathan begins to unwind on his vacation in the Bahamas, Carol's surprise appearance gets him riled up all over again until they meet Ganja Pete.

programme.title: The Millers: Tomlandia

programme.title: The Millers: Plus One
programme.desc: Nathan's excitement at scoring a ticket for himself and a guest to a dinner with President Obama turns to dread when he has to pick one of his family members to be his "plus one."

programme.title: The Millers: Walk-n-Wave
programme.desc: Worried that his mother has made him feel like he's better than other people, Nathan befriends a hopeless co-worker, Doug, who turns out to be a social outcast and more than Nathan knows how to handle.

programme.title: The Millers: Cancellation Fee
programme.desc: Nathan tries to date his mother's dentist in secret after Carol adds her to the Miller Family Blacklist for charging her a $75 cancellation fee for being late to her appointment.

programme.title: The Millers: 72
programme.desc: When Tom proudly tells the family he's dating a much younger woman, Nathan goes undercover to spy on him and make sure his father isn't being scammed by a gold digger.

programme.title: The Exes
programme.desc: Holly's boyfriend Paul orders the guys to not hang out with her when he's around. When Holly discovers what Paul did, she's forced to choose between poker night and date night.

programme.title: The Exes
programme.desc: Haskell's ex-wife Margo gets amnesia after an accident and stays with Haskell to recover, only she thinks they're still married. Phil and Stuart spend the night in Holly's place and get to know her intimate sleeping behavior.

programme.title: The Exes
programme.desc: When Holly despairs about dating again, the guys secretly create an online dating profile for her and discover what dating is like from a woman's perspective.

programme.title: The Exes
programme.desc: Haskell's ex-wife Margo gets amnesia after an accident and stays with Haskell to recover, only she thinks they're still married. Phil and Stuart spend the night in Holly's place and get to know her intimate sleeping behavior.

programme.title: The Exes
programme.sub-title: Take This Job and Shove It
programme.desc: When Phil and Holly make a pact to ask their bosses for raises, Phil gets fired. Holly tries to help Phil get his job back. Stuart's integrity is tested when he dates a British woman with repulsive teeth.

programme.title: The Exes
programme.desc: When Holly and Eden date two charming French men who shower them with gifts and glamorous living, they wonder if their dream dates are too good to be true. Phil and Haskell train Stuart on how to confront a bully at the bar.

programme.title: The Exes
programme.desc: Phil opens his own agency and enlists Eden as his temporary assistant to help sign his first client. Meanwhile, Holly hires Haskell as her temporary assistant. Stuart pursues the Yelper who smeared his practice's perfect rating.

programme.title: The Exes
programme.sub-title: The Hand That Rocks the Cradle
programme.desc: Holly dates a much younger man and Eden questions his motives. Phil and Eden secretly become friends with benefits. Stuart convinces Haskell to pursue a woman he's admired from afar and ends up accidentally stealing her cat.

programme.title: The Exes
programme.desc: Holly attends her ex-boyfriend Paul's wedding and throws it into chaos. At the wedding Phil and Eden realize they're developing feelings for each other. Haskell sets his sights on the most desperate woman at the wedding.

programme.title: The Exes
