programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 2
programme.desc: To better camouflage themselves as real Fire Nation citizens, the kids check out a Fire Nation school. Also, Zuko confronts Uncle.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 3
programme.desc: The gang arrive at a suffering Fire Nation fishing village, and a mysterious spirit appears to help the villagers.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 4
programme.desc: Sokka feels that he is not contributing enough to the group, and searches for a mysterious master to teach him the ways of the sword.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 5
programme.desc: Zuko, Azula, Mai, and Ty Lee go on vacation at Lo and Li's beach house, where they learn a lot about themselves and each other. Meanwhile, the kids face a new enemy.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 6
programme.desc: Aang and Zuko are taken on parallel adventures that give them insight into their forefathers' pasts, but how does the tale of Roku and Sozin matter to them now?

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 7
programme.desc: When Toph discovers a quick way to make cash, Katara disapproves, and the rift between them has disastrous consequences.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 8
programme.desc: In a spooky village, Katara makes a special connection; the group investigate strange disappearances that occur during full moons.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 9
programme.desc: On the eve of the eclipse, Aang's worry overtakes him and his dreams become nightmares. Before long, he can't tell the difference between what's real and what's not.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 10
programme.desc: With the day of the eclipse upon them, the kids, along with a ragtag force of old friends, enact their long-planned invasion of the Fire Nation.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 11
programme.desc: As the invasion force fights their way to the Fire Nation capital, the kids help Aang find the Firelord in time for the eclipse, but after a few surprises.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 12
programme.desc: When the group seek refuge at the Western Air temple, they find someone they weren't expecting has been following them and hopes to join their group.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 13
programme.desc: As Zuko teaches Aang firebending, it turns out Aang isn't the only one who needs a lesson. The two set-out to learn the true meaning of Firebending from the original teachers.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 14
programme.desc: Sokka and Zuko head to the Fire Nation's most heavily guarded prison - the Boiling Rock - in hopes to find and break-out the captured invasion force.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 15
programme.desc: Sokka and Zuko have to rethink their escape plan after things go wrong. They end up getting help from a few unexpected sources.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 16
programme.desc: Katara sets out to confront the Fire Nation soldier who killed her mother. However, no one knows what she will do when she finds him.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 17
programme.desc: When the kids see a new play about themselves and all of their past adventures, they aren't happy with the production.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 18
programme.desc: The kids learn new information about Firelord Ozai's master plan and decide to strike sooner than planned, but they are unsure if Aang is ready.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 19
programme.desc: While Firelord Ozai begins his master plan, the gang tries to stop him. Meanwhile, Aang seeks advice from his past lives.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 20
programme.desc: Suki, Toph, and Sokka try to stop the Fire Lord's fleet before they hit land, while Azula prepares for her coronation day.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 21
programme.desc: Sokka and Toph manage to disable the airships while Zuko and Katara confront Azula. Aang finally faces off against the Fire Lord.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 1
programme.desc: Katara and Sokka, a brother and sister from the Southern Water Tribe, discover a twelve-year-old boy frozen in an iceberg. Katara wonders if this boy is the Avatar whom the world has been awaiting.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 2
programme.desc: Prince Zuko, a young Firebender whose mission in life is to capture the Avatar, tracks Aang down to the Southern Water Tribe village where Katara and Sokka live.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 3
programme.desc: Aang is eager to take Sokka and Katara to the Air Temple where he was raised. But upon arrival, it becomes apparent that the temple is not at all how Aang remembers it.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 4
programme.desc: When locals of a small island discover Aang is the Avatar, they treat him like a celebrity.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 5
programme.desc: Aang takes Katara and Sokka to an Earthbender city. The kids cause damage and are brought before a crazy old king, who seems to enjoy messing with the kids' heads.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 6
programme.desc: The kids come to an Earth Nation town which is occupied by the Fire Nation. But will Katara's attempts to inspire the oppressed people help them or hurt them?

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 7
programme.desc: Aang, Katara, and Sokka arrive at a town being terrorized by a mysterious force from the spirit world. Aang doesn't know how to help these people, and realizes he has much to learn about being Avatar.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 8
programme.desc: During the winter solstice, Aang must reach a Fire Nation temple while dodging Prince Zuko, Commander Zhao, and the Fire Sages who guard it.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 9
programme.desc: When Katara's desire to master Waterbending gets the best of her, the kids find themselves on the run from pirates.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 10
programme.desc: Our heroes' friendship is tested when they meet Jet, a charismatic teenager leading a band of rebels who are fighting against the Fire Nation.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 11
programme.desc: When Aang and friends come to the rim of a giant canyon, they are asked to help guide two groups of refugees across. Aang quickly learns that this will be no easy task.

channel.desc: The world is divided into four elemental nations. The Avatar upholds the balance, but when the Fire Nation invaded, he vanishes. A hundred years later, Katara and Sokka discover the new Avatar, an airbender named Aang.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Pizza By The Shred
programme.desc: In order to locate the Turtles' lair and destroy them, Shredder opens a pizza parlour. When the Turtles order a pizza, Shredder places a locator-tracking device on it disguised as an anchovy.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Super Bebop & Mighty Rocksteady
programme.desc: Krang creates Cybernetic Clones of Rocksteady, only ten times as strong and ten times as smart.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Blast From the Past
programme.desc: Shredder endeavours to enlist the aid of the ghost of Shibano-Sama, a noble warrior who lived hundreds of years ago, to destroy the Turtles.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Leatherhead: Terror of the Swamp
programme.desc: The Turtles go south to the swamps when their friends the Frogs -and Napoleon Bonafrog - are in trouble. The source of their predicament is Leatherhead, a half-human, half-alligator mutation.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Michelangelo's Birthday
programme.desc: It's Michelangelo's birthday - and his good buddies are pretending they're unaware of it.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Usagi Yojimbo
programme.desc: Shredder's Teleporter, which can teletransport objects to a pre­determined location, interferes with Donatello's transdimensional reception - and Usagi Yojimbo, a 14th century Samurai rabbit, pops out of the Turtles' screen.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Case of the Hot Kimono
programme.sub-title: The Case of the Hot Kimono
programme.desc: Agatha Marble helps the Turtles in their pursuit of Don Turtelli, including Splinter's treasured red robe - and holding Happy Hour News' April and Vernon prisoners.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Usagi, Come Home
programme.desc: Shredder has a hare-brained scheme to turn the rabbit from another dimension, Usagi Yojimbo, into an ally of his and an enemy of the Turtles.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Making of Metalhead
programme.desc: Krang creates Metalhead, an exact robot replica of the Turtles with even more powers, and directs him to destroy the Turtles. Donatello, however, reprograms Metalhead over to the Turtles' side.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Leatherhead Meets the Rat King
programme.desc: Leatherhead The Cajan gator goes into the sewers in pursuit of the Turtles, and encounters the Rat King, who has stolen a tanker­truck of rat poison which he plans to change into a hypnotic gas.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Turtle Terminator
programme.desc: Shredder captures Irma and creates an android Irma programmed to destroy the Turtles. The zap-happy robotic Irma causes havoc in the TV newsroom.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Great Boldini
programme.desc: Mobster Don Turtelli and his cousin the magician, the Great Baldini, steal the famous Tortellini Emerald.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Missing Map
programme.desc: The Turtles are showing Zach, "the fifth Turtle," and his brother Walt their scrapbook.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Gang's All Here
programme.desc: Michelangelo falls for a Shredder trick and eats a chocolate chip cookie made with anti-mutagen capable of turning him into a human being.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Grybyx
programme.desc: The Neutrinos - Dask, Kala and Zak - are back on Earth in search of Kala's pet Grybyx, a small and cuddly creature that, "mega bizzarro," can turn into a humongous monster.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Mister Ogg Goes to Town
programme.desc: When Krang realizes the Technodrome is running low on liquid nitrogen, its main source of fuel, he discovers that a formula exists in Dimension Z which transmutes crude oil, easily available on Earth, into liquid nitrogen.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Shredderville
programme.desc: Because of all the destruction Shredder causes just trying to get rid of the Turtles, they lament that the world would be a better place had they never existed.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Bye - Bye Fly!
programme.desc: Plotting revenge, Baxter, who has been turned into a fly-like creature, delivers a borellium crystal to Krang and Shredder whose Technodrome is low in power.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Big Ripoff
programme.desc: The Technodrome is perilously close to running out of power as it teeters on the edge of a crumbling lava cliff deep within the bowels of the Earth.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Big Break-In
programme.desc: Krang and Shredder get the Technodrome rolling again and raise it to the centre of the Earth.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Big Blow-Out
programme.desc: Krang and Shredder raise the Technodrome to the surface and seize unlimited energy. The Turtles and the World face their darkest hour.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Plan Six from Outer Space
programme.desc: The Turtles launch the missile from the sewers positioned under the Technodrome. It transports Bebop, Rocksteady, Krang and Shredder back to Dimension X but explodes on impact; they survive.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Turtles of the Jungle
programme.desc: Donatello's idol, inventor mad-scientist Professor Willard creates the Molecular Intensifier, a machine to control growth of living things.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Michelangelo Toys Around
programme.desc: Michelangelo dreams he's being attacked by Tyranno-toys. He wakes up to hear April announcing the Toy Fair opening. Determined to go, Michelangelo disguises himself as a Turtle toy.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Peking Turtles
programme.desc: April O'Neil reports from the Uptown Museum about a display of artifacts from the 2000-year-old Ying Dynasty of China. The marble warriors were built to protect the world's largest pearl from being stolen from the Emperor's collection of jewels.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Shredder's Mother
programme.desc: The earth is experiencing global warming and Krang and Shredder threaten to expose it to increased catastrophic weather conditions.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Four Turtles and A Baby
programme.desc: The Neutrinos are attacked and their leaders, Zenter and Grizzla, are seized by Krang, Shredder and General Traag.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Turtlemaniac
programme.desc: Widespread thievery is discovered in the city when Ninja Turtle artifacts are found missing. April and Irma prowl for the pilfering poachers, the investigation leads the reporter to the estate of Monroe Q.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Rondo in New York
programme.desc: Word spreads that Oswald Oren, a nerdy Woody Allen-type student, has developed the Vitalizer - an experimental substance that brings inanimate objects to life. Scoundrels Shredder, Krang, Bebop and Rocksteady connive to steal the potion.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Planet of the Turtles
programme.desc: A commercial for the Personal Energy Projector (PEP), allowing the transfer of energy from one source to another, entices Krang. Targeting Earth, he drains the sphere's energy to strengthen the Technodrome.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Name That Toon
programme.desc: Krang threatens to vapourize the city by manipulating a Dematerializer, but a musical instrument that Howie, Irma's friend, plays around with, interferes with the device's programming.

channel.desc: Cowabunga! Straight from the sewers, the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles are here and ready to take on alien and mutant enemies alike. Grab some pizza and get ready for maximum Turtle Power! This is TOTALLY TURTLES on Pluto TV!

programme.title: Riptide: #1 With A Bullet
programme.desc: When a music star is killed in a car accident and the equally famous passenger gets injured, the Riptide agency gets hired by his fanclub to deliver flowers to his hospital bed.

programme.title: Riptide: Long Distance Daddy
programme.desc: Nick's sponsor child comes from Cambodia to the USA so his sister can undergo heart surgery.

programme.title: Riptide: Double Your Pleasure
programme.desc: Cody's flirt with a pretty girl sends the boys on a search for her apparently missing sister. Her ties to a mobster make them a target for him and his goons.

programme.title: Riptide: Raiders Of The Lost Sub
programme.desc: Well educated, but just as goofy, Murray's sister shows up unexpectedly, and persuades the boys to look for a sunken WW2 German submarine.

programme.title: Riptide: Something Fishy
programme.desc: Boz and Nick both fall for the same beautiful dolphin-trainer, whose charges become implicated as accomplices in a drug-smuggling scheme.

programme.title: Riptide: Where The Girls Are
programme.desc: The Riptide trio is tasked with protecting three high maintenance women from kidnappers during their California vacation.

programme.title: Riptide: The Orange Grove
programme.desc: An army general they befriended in Vietnam, is suspected of dealing cocaine, and the boys are pressured by the FBI to Lure him out.

programme.title: Riptide: Catch Of The Day
programme.desc: A murder at sea is witnessed by a girl swimming, who relays it to a mentally challenged fisherman.

programme.title: Riptide: Mirage
programme.desc: One of Murray's students asks his help to get away from her abusive husband. He agrees to help the beautiful woman, but soon finds out she is not as innocent as she appears to be.

programme.title: Riptide: Beat The Box
programme.desc: Murray's lie detector causes aggrevation for Nick and Cody, but also proves quite helpful when a writer they are hired to protect jumps from a high building.

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: Blabber Talker
programme.desc: Appa and Umma search for an excuse to avoid vacationing with the Lees. Janet scores a lucrative but awkward photography gig.

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: Elephant in the Room
programme.desc: Kimchee gets conflicting dating advice from Jung and Shannon. Janet's outraged when she learns that Umma's sold off her childhood keepsakes.

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: Appanticitis
programme.desc: Appa gives Umma feedback on an annoying habit and promptly regrets it. Janet bumps into an old flame and Jung considers giving reality TV a shot.

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: Hit 'n' Fun
programme.desc: A small fender bender leads to a big argument between Appa and Umma. Jung second-guesses a birthday greeting. Janet goes from mocker to mocked.

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: Lord of the Ring
programme.desc: Umma tries to find her missing wedding ring before Appa does. Jung crashes Janet's yoga class.

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: The Trollop

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: Couch Surfing
programme.desc: Appa is reluctant to have a house guest, but Umma is the one who ends up having problems with their visitor. Jung accuses Janet of being coldhearted and Shannon tackles workplace bullying .

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: The Help
programme.desc: Umma is mistaken for a server at a school event for Janet. Appa takes up math tutoring to prove his teaching prowess. Meanwhile, Shannon is finally single but isn't sure if Jung will make a move.

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: Happy Ummaversary
programme.desc: Janet plans to get the Kim family together for their first family dinner in 15 years, but it almost proves too much for Jung and Appa to handle.

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: Thinkin' About Inkin'
programme.desc: Janet considers a new tattoo. Jung and Shannon exchange five-week-iversary gifts. Umma and Appa discover some juicy gossip about Pastor Nina.

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: Soccer Dad
programme.desc: Appa unwittingly becomes Jung's soccer coach. Umma insists that Janet learn to cook. Shannon forces a birthday party on Stacie.

programme.title: Kim's Convenience: Beacon of Truth
programme.desc: Appa eavesdrops on Gerald and Chelsea getting together to tell a lie to her parents. Appa says that he knows whenever Janet has told a lie.

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: Marty ends up in hospital after the beach party. Meanwhile, Boss Anna has some big news for Sophie, Nathan has an unusual plan to help Chloe, and Gaz comes to a decision over Charlotte. (S13, ep7)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: It's Holly's birthday and she gets a massive surprise when Kyle shows up. Marty goes in on Chloe but takes it too far. Meanwhile, Aaron and Marnie's relationship reaches breaking point. (S13, ep8)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: The Geordies reach boiling point... Marty tries to make it up to Chloe, but will she forgive him? And is there any way back for Aaron and Marnie after the previous night's break up? (S13, ep9)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: In the series finale Chloe and Marty get flirty again, but can they really stay just good friends? Kyle gets some big news from Boss Anna, but the fallout will change the family forever. (S13, ep10)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: The Geordies are back! Big Boss Anna shocks the Squad when she sends in some new workers to join them. The lads are excited but Sophie and Chloe aren’t so sure and things quickly go west. (S14, ep1)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: Aaron and Marty decide to get close to newbies Sarah and Abbie. After her kick-off with Zahida, Chloe gets some big news. And the family is stunned when two more new workers arrive. (S14, ep2)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: Nathan plans to test how radge the new workers are. Chloe returns, Marnie and Marty kick off over Aaron and there’s a huge shock when the next newbie arrives. Marty reaches out to Chloe. (S14, ep3)

programme.title: Geordie Shore
programme.desc: Marty's plan to win Elettra over with a new hair colour goes west. Marnie's worried she's sending out mixed signals to Aaron. And when a new radgie arrives Chloe is all over him. (S14, ep4)

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Bridesmaid Meltdown
programme.desc: A bridesmaid drinks herself into a dangerous coma; a man's eyeball pops out of his head; a premature infant is left in a hospital toilet and must be quickly revived in the ER.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: We Have A Heartbeat
programme.desc: A carjacker has shot a policewoman in the chest; A homeless woman has cellulitis; A drug dealer is unresponsive after having been beaten. Two middle-aged men with severe burns; A man in his 70s has been found unresponsive in a public place.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: ER RUNAROUND
programme.desc: A patient appears to be hallucinating and sends ER staff on a wild goose chase around the hospital; a doctor gets a jolt of electricity that stops his heart when he touches a patient who is being defibrillated.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Exorcism In The ER
programme.desc: A man goes into anaphylactic shock; a tough guy fears needles; a man stabs himself with a ninja sword; a patient believes she needs an exorcism.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Say Your Prayers
programme.desc: A man is bitten by a deadly rattlesnake, but because of religious reasons cannot receive a blood transfusion. Will he survive?

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Belly Dancer Mystery
programme.desc: Two patients are admitted into the ER, both experiencing seizures; an elderly man's lung collapses, and his young wife and his daughter fight over him; a belly dancer collapses at a hooka bar, and doctors must figure out why.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Size Matters
programme.desc: A woman risks losing her finger after trying on an ill-fitting engagement ring; a body builder can't breathe; a doctor takes a break outside and is nearly struck by a car driven by her next patient, a gunshot victim.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER: Director Down
programme.desc: A ruptured brain aneurysm threatens to kill the ER's medical director, making Dr Yamarick face one of his most difficult moments.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction: Laxatives and Pottery/Ashes
programme.desc: Kimberly takes hundreds of laxatives a day in an attempt to lose weight. Meanwhile, Bianca prefers to eat pottery and cigarette ashes instead of food.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction: Hair Puller/Shoe Fanatic
programme.desc: Showcases a woman addicted to shoes, while another is addicted to pulling her hair and eating the follicle.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction: Casting / Psychics
programme.desc: Profiled are Kevin, who constantly covers his body in plaster casts even though he is not injured, and Melissa who is incapable of making a decision without a consulting a psychic.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction: Sucker/Bodybuilder
programme.desc: Lauren was once addicted to drugs and alcohol, but now is addicted to body-building, which may have caused long term health problems. Meanwhile, Rhonda has been addicted to sucking her thumb ever since her parents divorced when she was a child.

programme.title: My Crazy Obsession: This Little Piggy_All Dolled Up
programme.desc: Sharon’s collection of pig items has exceeded 6,000 and adorns almost every square inch of her home. Rebecca’s obsession with Barbie dolls includes styling her own hair and wardrobe to match her dolls.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction: Eats Cleanser/Tanner
programme.desc: Ever since she was twelve Crystle has been obsessed with eating household cleanser. Samantha is addicted to tanning and visits multiple tanning salons in order to get her fix.

programme.title: My Crazy Obsession: My Crazy Obsession Christmas Spcl 1
programme.desc: My Crazy Obsession: Christmas Collection takes you inside the lives of extreme collectors who have taken holiday decorating to the max. For these obsessed collectors, it's Christmas year round.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction: Can’t Stop Cleaning/Love Rocks
programme.desc: Cyntrelle dropped out of high school because of her addiction to cleaning. Belinda's obsession with rocks has taken over her life, with more than 100,000 scattered around her home.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction: Eats Detergent/Strongman
programme.desc: 19-year-old Tempestt eats detergent up to seven times a day, not to mention the soap she eats in the shower. Meanwhile, Jeff is addicted to strongman competitions training up to six hours a day.

programme.title: My Crazy Obsession: My Crazy Obsession Pilot
programme.desc: My Collection Obsession takes you deep inside the world of four of the country’s most obsessed collectors each taking their material obsession to jaw-dropping extremes.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction: Ventriloquist/Cat Lady
programme.desc: April's addiction to her puppets has gotten so strong she can't go anywhere without them. Debbie is severely allergic to cats, but has over twenty of them, leaving her in isolation.

programme.title: My Crazy Obsession: Grown-Up Baby
programme.desc: Stanley, 31, has been obsessed with being an adult baby for the past 18 years. Every day he wears footie pajamas, eats baby food, wears a diaper and sleeps in a crib.

programme.title: My Strange Addiction: Gas Sniffer/Teddy Bear Obsession
programme.desc: For more than 30 years, Theresa has been addicted to smelling gasoline. Meanwhile, former drug-addict Krista has 12 'children' -- all of which are teddy bears.

channel.desc: From eating cat hair to marrying a carnival ride, the extreme health channel has all types of unusual behaviours and strange conditions that will have you glued to your TV .

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Open Concept (Part 1)
programme.desc: This week's episode features Cambridge realtor extraordinaire Steve Bailey as he helps couple Dan and Melinda search for the perfect home. It's a real battle of contemporary vs. traditional as Dan and Melinda.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Open Concept (Part 2)
programme.desc: This episode features the last two of four properties, as well as the reveal of which house the clients decide to purchase, with a special guest appearance by interior design expert Shelley Alexanian.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: A Big Investment (Part 1)
programme.desc: Vancouver-based couple Jim and Shannon are looking to relocate to their hometown of Toronto with their two daughters. With a budget of 10 million dollars, they enlist the help of savvy realtor Sofie Kehdi.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: A Big Investment (Part 2)
programme.desc: This episode features the last two of four properties, as well as the reveal of which house the clients decide to purchase, with a special appearance by guest agent Tyrone N. Steer.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Magical Home (Part 1)
programme.desc: Off on another adventure! This episode takes Mike Donia on a whirlwind tour of Southeast Asia as he searches for a home for his clients, Antonio and Kim. Featuring properties in Thailand.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Magical Home (Part 2)
programme.desc: Off on another adventure! This episode takes Mike Donia on a whirlwind tour of Southeast Asia as he searches for a home for his clients, Antonio and Kim. Featuring properties in Thailand.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Income for a Rainy Day (Part 1)
programme.desc: Vezi and Deborah love the house they purchased last season in Stouffville, but they are ready to make the move to the big city. They enlist the help of Inez Kudryk to show them the best properties she can find in Toronto.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Income for a Rainy Day (Part 2)
programme.desc: Vezi and Deborah love the house they purchased last season in Stouffville, but they are ready to make the move to the big city. They enlist the help of Inez Kudryk to show them the best properties she can find in Toronto.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Tricky Choice (Part 1)
programme.desc: Laura and Steven are a young couple with an expanding family, and are ready to take the next steps in home ownership. They want a large plot of land for their young children to run around and enjoy nature.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Tricky Choice (Part 2)
programme.desc: Laura and Steven are a young couple with an expanding family, and are ready to take the next steps in home ownership. They want a large plot of land for their young children to run around and enjoy nature.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: We Bought a Resort (Part 1)
programme.desc: Sofie Kehdi heads back to Belize to help husband and wife team Rachel and Ben size up some resort properties. Along with their investors, Rachel and Ben are looking to purchase a resort on the island of Ambergris Caye.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: We Bought a Resort (Part 2)
programme.desc: Sofie Kehdi heads back to Belize to help husband and wife team Rachel and Ben size up some resort properties. Along with their investors, Rachel and Ben are looking to purchase a resort on the island of Ambergris Caye.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Net Zero
programme.desc: Julie and James are looking for a new home to raise their two boys. James is in the tech industry and would love an energy efficient home.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Wow Factor
programme.desc: Giulia and Scott have recently come into an inheritance and want the house of their dreams. Currently, they live in a modest bungalow in a busy neighbourhood but would prefer to live in a secluded house.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: My Daughter's Plan
programme.desc: Kevin is a retired, successful businessman. He is a single dad to Shannon and Jennifer. Shannon has been accepted into the Ontario Veterinarian College at the University of Guelph.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Feels Like Home
programme.desc: Laura is on the hunt for a new home for long time clients Marino and Paula. The couple and their three kids would like a spacious house with a country feel to escape their hectic lifestyles.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Century Homes
programme.desc: Louise, Jason, and their two children have been living in Europe for the past 10 years, but now they would like to be closer to their family in Canada. Louise absolutely adores the European aesthetic.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Waterfront
programme.desc: Diogo is a dedicated musician working on his new album. He has been debating between moving to Miami or staying in Canada. Toronto is closer to his family and where he feels at home with his music.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Retirement
programme.desc: Elizabeth and Michael are retired and want to move closer to their kids and grandchildren. They want to downsize from their two-story house into a bungalow. Luckily, Eve knows all about luxury bungalows.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Sweet Country Home
programme.desc: Tomarra and Rob had just married and blended their two families. As a new family, they want to transition to a quiet neighbourhood away from the hustle and bustle of Toronto. Steve is up for the challenge.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: A Smart Decision
programme.desc: Darlene and Bruce are in the market for a new home and have enlisted Laura to help them out. Darlene's one request is that they stay close to their current home, where their daughter goes to school.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Pool House
programme.desc: Kathryn and Neil are true urbanites. They love what downtown Toronto has to offer. When Neil found out his company was relocating to Guelph, they weren't thrilled.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Love the Location
programme.desc: Ashley and Ali are ready to take their relationship and living situation to the next level. The young entrepreneurs are prepared to move into a house, but the one thing they can't agree on is where to live.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Big Move
programme.desc: Stephanie is making a big move from BC to Guelph to be closer to her son John and his family. She doesn't want the move to be a hassle and is looking for an accessible, decent-sized home for her grandchildren and visitors from BC.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: My Favourite Homes
programme.desc: Steve Bailey, Mike Donia and Daryl King review their favourite homes. Steve takes us down memory lane to his 18th century farmhouse, and another home with a stunning infinity pool.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: House For an Athlete
programme.desc: ??George is a retired basket ball player, and Mada is an international model. For a man over 7 feet tall, finding the perfect house might be a challenge. Danielle knows high ceilings come in all shapes and sizes.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Treetops
programme.desc: Suhail and Niki have busy schedules. He's a marketing director and she's a doctor so she's often on call for a hospital downtown.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Above and Beyond
programme.desc: Wendy and Daniel are looking to downsize after their kids have moved out, but still want an elegant home. She's a physical therapist and she's a business analyst.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Energized
programme.desc: Danielle is helping quite a pair, Joseph is a chiropractor and Nadia is an aerospace engineer. They're looking for a home to start a family. Not only that, they want space to host their extended family. Will it be as difficult as rocket science?

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Fabulous
programme.desc: Janelle and Manuel are young professionals looking for more space. With one child tagging along on the tour already, they need a place for their growing family. They might need to do some renovations, but they want everything to be perfect.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent: Fun House
programme.desc: These two business owners Joseph and Heather work hard and want to play hard! They're looking for a place to entertain guests, and Daryl's got some amazing homes to show them.

channel.desc: From first-time homebuyers to experienced investors, TMDA has something for everyone, affording a peek into the sumptuous world of international luxury homeownership.

programme.title: COPS: Mean Girls Times Two
programme.desc: Deputies are forced to taser a man after pursuing him into a field. A driver plays dumb when asked about the revolver under his car seat. Officers respond to two teenage girls in a fight.

programme.title: COPS: Uncomfortable Shoes
programme.desc: A driver takes police on a neighborhood chase. Officers are called to capture a 12-foot python hiding outside a home. Officers suspect a motorist with a funny walk is hiding something up his shoe.

programme.title: COPS: Cops The Young and the Reckless
programme.sub-title: Cops The Young and the Reckless
programme.desc: Police catch up to a man with warrants and a history of resisting arrest, a fidgety driver arouses suspicion, and a minor with beers in his pants has to answer to his mom.

programme.title: COPS: Cops One Headlight
programme.desc: A man pulls out all the stops to elude the police, a civilian steps in when she spots a violent crime in progress, and a suspected shoplifter is confronted by officers.

programme.title: COPS: Cops Just Hanging Out
programme.desc: A jumpy bicyclist mistakenly reveals more than he had planned, and officers search a darkened building in an attempt to thwart a robbery in progress.

programme.title: COPS: Cops Mom Still Loves You
programme.desc: Officers track down a suspect who eluded them earlier, a suspicious vehicle takes off at the sight of police, and a man gets busted for possession in front of his mom.

programme.title: COPS: Cops Cookies and Contraband
programme.desc: A detective is injured after chasing a man driving a stolen car, a bar fight ends with a couple in handcuffs, and an officer finds a variety of items during a vehicle search.

programme.title: COPS: Cops A Man Without a Plan
programme.sub-title: Cops A Man Without a Plan
programme.desc: A young man receives a wake-up call when police catch him breaking the law, and officers play peacemakers after a board game sparks a family feud.

programme.title: COPS: The House Always Wins
programme.desc: A suspect runs from an illegal gambling game claiming shots were fired. A man is caught trespassing on school grounds. A male driver wearing a halter top is pulled over for a minor traffic violation.

programme.title: COPS: Penalty Box
programme.desc: A man sneaking away from a bar fight clams he was chased by a truck. Deputies are called when a woman assaults people at a skating rink. A drunk man abandons his truck on train tracks.

programme.title: COPS: The Car is Mine!
programme.desc: A man locks himself in a trunk after deputies respond to a restraining order call. Deputies respond to two women arguing over the ownership of a car.

programme.title: COPS: Cops Window of Opportunity
programme.desc: Officers apprehend an armed suspect, the cops are called when a man damages his neighbor's window, and deputies investigate a parking garage known for illegal activity.

programme.title: COPS: Cops The Truth Is Key
programme.desc: A desperate suspect flees from the cops after shots are fired, and a father and daughter are caught off-guard when they run into a man wielding a screwdriver.

programme.title: COPS: Nothing Upstairs
programme.desc: Officers pursue a motorcyclist driving erratically. Deputies find broken drug paraphernalia in a car when conducting a traffic stop. A man who beat up his girlfriend hides from officers in an attic.

programme.title: COPS: Tow Time
programme.desc: Police conduct a high-speed chase on a car with a missing tire. Police respond to a tow truck driver being assaulted. Police are called when a relative attacks a woman's husband.

programme.title: COPS: Doggie Dispute
programme.desc: Deputies pursue a man wanted in connection with a family violence call. Detectives are called to a dispute between neighbors over an unleashed dog.

programme.title: COPS: Cops Better Safe Than Sorry
programme.desc: Officers try to calm an agitated and disoriented man before he hurts himself or someone else, and a driver going 2 MPH on a highway catches the attention of a patrol car.

programme.title: COPS: Cops Manic Monday
programme.desc: A wanted man attempts to hide at his grandmother's house, police arrest a suspect driving a stolen vehicle, and officers call animal control for an injured dog.

programme.title: COPS starts at 9pm
programme.desc: Cops gives viewers access into the daily lives and work of the men and women of law enforcement. Filmed on location, the groundbreaking series follows real officers on patrol as they conduct high-speed pursuits, wild arrests and dangerous police business.
